item.title: Pancakes
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Not vegan, contains eggs and milk!

Ingredients

  • 250 g flour
  • 2 tablespoons baking powder
  • 500 g milk
  • 2 or 3 eggs
  • A bit of butter

Preparation

  1. Mix the flour and the baking powder
  2. Slowly add the milk and mix
  3. Add the eggs and mix
  4. Add a bit of butter to a large pan and heat
  5. Make the pancakes

item.title: Bananabread
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

For the cake

  • 125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
  • 125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
  • 125 grams brown sugar
  • 150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
  • 1 good pinch of sea salt
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
  • Zest and juice of 1 lemon
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
  • 2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten

For the Lemon-Sesame Drizzle (optional)

  • 1 tablespoon tahini
  • 3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
  • Juice of 1 lemon

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
  2. Grease a non-stick loaf pan with butter and dust it with flour (if the loaf pan is not non-stick, you can also line it with parchment paper).
  3. Combine all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl - flours, sugar, seeds, salt, and baking powder - and mix well.
  4. In another bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (leaving them slightly chunky if desired), then add lemon juice and zest, olive oil, yogurt, and beaten eggs, mixing well.
  5. Add the wet ingredients to the bowl of dry ingredients and gently mix - just enough to combine everything.
  6. Transfer the mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
  7. Optional: While the cake is baking, prepare the Lemon Drizzle. Stir tahini and powdered sugar in a bowl until smooth, add lemon juice, and mix well.
  8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan until it’s cool enough to transfer to a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, place a large plate under the rack, then poke the cake all over with a skewer, pour the drizzle over it, and let it soak in.

item.title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

For the Brownies

  • 200 g Dark Chocolate
  • 125 g Softened Butter
  • 1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
  • 3 Eggs
  • 200 g Brown Sugar
  • 150 g Flour
  • 1 tsp Baking Powder
  • 1 Pinch of Salt
  • 1 tbsp Cocoa Powder

For the Dessert

  • 1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
  • 2 tsp Cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
  • 400 g Cream
  • 250 g Low-Fat Quark
  • 4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

Preparation

Brownies

  1. Melt dark chocolate with butter in a double boiler. Let it cool briefly.
  2. Mix vanilla sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together.
  3. Add the chocolate-butter mixture and mix.
  4. Mix flour with baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder, and stir into the remaining batter.
  5. Grease a brownie pan (28.5 x 23 cm).
  6. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (convection: 160 degrees).
  7. Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes.
  8. Allow the brownies to cool completely.

Cherry Compote

  1. Drain the Morello cherries over a sieve, collecting 400ml of juice.
  2. Mix about 2 tbsp of the juice with cornstarch and powdered sugar until smooth.
  3. Heat the remaining juice in a pot. Add the starch-juice mixture and bring to a boil until it starts to thicken.
  4. Add the drained cherries and stir well.
  5. Let it cool slightly.

Creamy Quark Cream

  1. Whip the cream until stiff and mix with low-fat quark and powdered sugar.
  2. Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the cherry mixture onto the brownie pieces in the glass.

Assembly

  1. Take 1 tablespoon of brownies and break it into small pieces.
  2. Place brownie pieces in dessert glasses (approx. 125ml filling capacity).
  3. Pipe a layer of cream onto the cherry mixture in each glass.
  4. Repeat this process for another layer in each dessert glass.
  5. Refrigerate dessert glasses until ready to serve.

Source

https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/schwarzwaelder-kirsch-dessert-einfach-selber-machen

item.title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 180 g Soft Dates, pitted
  • 200 ml Cream
  • 3 Eggs
  • 1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
  • 4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
  • 100 g Flour
  • 1.5 tsp Baking Soda
  • 80 g Butter
  • Some Butter for greasing the pan

Preparation

  1. Preheat the oven to 170 °C (convection).
  2. Puree dates with cream, vanilla bean seeds, and cocoa powder until smooth.
  3. Then add egg yolks and butter, and blend until the mixture is homogeneous and smooth.
  4. Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
  5. Mix the flour and baking soda into the cocoa mixture.
  6. Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.
  7. Pour the cake batter into any buttered baking pan.
  8. Bake in the preheated oven on the middle rack for approximately 40 minutes.

Notes

The recipe yields 16 pieces and is also suitable for muffin molds. You can enhance the cake with orange zest, ground nuts, nut butter, chili, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, or cherries. I use soft dates, which are softer than regular dates. If you only have firm dates, soak them in warm water for about 4 hours. I would use a cake pan with a diameter of 18 cm. Source: https://www.chefkoch.de/rezepte/3186881474309297/Feiner-Schokokuchen-ohne-Zuckerzusatz.html

item.title: Lentil Bolognese
item.dc:creator: Lennart Wittkuhn
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 clove of garlic
  • 1 onion
  • 1 carrot
  • 1 stalk of celery
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tablespoons tomato paste
  • 150 g red lentils
  • 400 g strained tomatoes - or chopped tomatoes (= 1 tin)
  • 250 ml vegetable stock
  • 1 tbsp Italian herbs
  • salt
  • pepper

Procedure

  1. Wash the lentils thoroughly, then set aside.
  2. Finely chop the garlic and onion, dice the carrot and celery.
  3. Heat the oil in a pan and sauté the onions.
  4. Add the carrots and celery and fry for 5 minutes over a medium heat.
  5. Stir in the tomato purée, garlic and herbs.
  6. Add the tomato purée, vegetable stock and lentils, bring to the boil, cover and simmer over a medium heat for 15 minutes. Add water if necessary.

Source: https://www.gaumenfreundin.de/rote-linsenbolognese-einfach-und-vegan/

item.title: Cinnamon Roll
item.dc:creator: mrugseniisc
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 (12.4 ounce) can refrigerated cinnamon rolls (such as Pillsbury™)
  • 1/4 cup white sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 4 ounces cream cheese, softened
  • 3/4 cup confectioner’s sugar
  • 1 tablespoon freshly grated orange peel
  • 1 tablespoon orange juice
  • icing from the cinnamon roll package

Procedure

  1. Preheat an air fryer to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Add sugar and cinnamon to a large resealable plastic bag, and shake to combine.
  2. Remove the 8 cinnamon rolls from the can, and set icing aside. Cut each roll into 4 equal pieces for a total of 32 bites.
  3. Line the fryer basket with parchment paper. Place the bites in a single layer in the bottom of the basket, cook for 3 minutes, turn over using tongs, and cook until golden brown, another 2 to 3 minutes. Depending on the brand and size of your air fryer, you may have to cook in batches, and your timing may vary, so watch closely.
  4. Meanwhile, prepare the dip. Add cream cheese, confectioner’s sugar, orange zest, orange juice, and the packaged icing to a small bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until you reach a dipping consistency, about 1 minute.
  5. Drop the warm pieces into the sugar-cinnamon mixture, and shake. Transfer to a plate or basket, and serve with the dip.

item.title: Potato salad
item.dc:creator: mareikelwagner
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 kilogram Potatoes
  • 1 Onion
  • 5 Eggs
  • 1 Jar of pickles
  • 1 Can of peas and carrots
  • 1 glass Miracel Whip light
  • Salt and pepper

Procedure

  1. Boil the potatoes and eggs and then peel them. When both are cold, cut them into small squares.
  2. Take the pickles out of the jar and keep the water, because you need it later. Then cut the pickles and the onion as well in little pieces.
  3. Drain the carrots and peas. Cut the carrots in slices.
  4. Put the potatoes, pickles, carrots, the onion and the peas into a big bowl.
  5. For the sauce mix Miracel Whip with some water from the jar of pickles, salt and pepper. Add a part of this to the bowl.
  6. Mix the ingredients in the bowl carefully. If it is to dry, add more of the sauce.
  7. Add more salt and pepper according to your taste.
  8. To ensure that it tastes really good, you should prepare the salad a few hours before eating it. You can also prepare it one day before.

item.title: Banana Brownies
item.dc:creator: gloriaroe
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3 bananas
  • 300 g Dark chocolate coating
  • 250 g butter
  • 3 eggs (size M)
  • 250 g sugar
  • 50 ml of neutral oil (e.g. sunflower oil)
  • 2 TSP vanilla extract
  • 200 g wheat flour (type 405)
  • 30 g Baking cocoa
  • 1 TSP baking powder
  • some butter and wheat flour for the cake pan

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees top/bottom heat (fan oven: 160 degrees). Grease a baking tin (20 cm x 23 cm) with a little butter and dust with flour. For the batter, peel the bananas and mash with a fork to a fine paste.
  2. Finely chop the dark chocolate coating and melt it together with the butter in a metal bowl over a hot water bath. Beat the eggs and sugar until frothy, then mix in the melted chocolate mixture and the oil. Stir in the mashed bananas and vanilla extract.
  3. Mix the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder in a bowl and sieve into the batter. Mix in briefly, then pour into the prepared tin and smooth out.
  4. Bake the brownies in a preheated oven for approx. 30-35 minutes. Leave to cool for at least 2 hours after baking.

Source

https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/bananen-brownies-so-saftig-schokoladig

item.title: Vegan Brownies
item.dc:creator: MariaJakubowski
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 Cup All Purpose Flour
  • 1 Cup Granulated Sugar
  • 1/2 Cup Cocoa Powder
  • 1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
  • 1/2 Cup Water
  • 1/2 Cup Vegetable Oil or melted Coconut Oil
  • 1 Teaspoon Vanilla Extract
  • 1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
  • 1/4 Chopped Nuts (optional)

Procedure

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking pan or line it with parchment paper.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
  3. Add the water, vegetable oil (or melted coconut oil), and vanilla extract to the dry mixture. Stir until the batter is smooth and well combined.
  4. If using, fold in the vegan chocolate chips and chopped nuts.
  5. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan, spreading it out evenly. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with a few moist crumbs.
  6. Allow the brownies to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before cutting into squares.
  7. Enjoy your vegan brownies plain or with a scoop of vegan ice cream on top!

Tips:

For an extra fudgy texture, reduce the baking time slightly. Feel free to customize your brownies with your favorite mix-ins like dried fruits or seeds.

Enjoy your homemade vegan brownies!

item.title: Raspberry Sponge Cake with Meringue
item.dc:creator: LucaCoolGirl
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 4 egg white
  • 4 egg yolk
  • 270g sugar
  • 1 vanilla sugar
  • 60 g flour
  • 50 g corn starch
  • 1/2 TL baking powder
  • 600 g frozen raspberries
  • 0,5l cream

Procedure

  1. Whisk the egg whites and egg yolks and vanilla sugar stiff for a very long time until foamy (2 egg whites, 4 egg yolks, 1 vanilla sugar)
  2. Sift in the flour, cornstarch and baking powder and pour everything into a greased springform pan (60 g of flour, 50 g of cornstarch, 1 teaspoon of baking powder)
  3. Whisk the egg whites and sugar stiff until foamy and spoon onto the batter (2 egg whites, 230 g of sugar)
  4. Bake at 175 degrees for about half an hour on the middle to lower rack.
  5. Then let the cake cool and cut it in the middle.
  6. Place the frozen raspberries on the bottom half, sprinkle with sugar, and then spread the whipped cream (600 g of frozen raspberries, 40 g of sugar, 0.5 liters of whipped cream)
  7. Place the top half of the cake on the filling and let it stand for a few hours (not in the refrigerator). Alternatively, you can thaw the raspberries beforehand if there is not enough time.

item.title: Tomatosoup
item.dc:creator: luap3
item.description:
Ingredients

  • Butter – use unsalted butter to saute onions
  • Yellow onion – it seems like a ton of onion but it disappears into the soup adding a balanced sweetness
  • Garlic – you’ll need 1 Tbsp minced from about 3 cloves
  • Crushed tomatoes – with their juice, preferably
  • San Marzano tomatoes Chicken stock – for the best flavor use homemade chicken broth
  • 1/4 cup fresh basil, plus more to serve. Basil leaves are easily bruised so chop by stacking a bunch of leaves then roll them into a log and cut into thin strips.
  • Sugar – It’s just 1 Tbsp, but necessary to combat the tomato acidity.
  • Black pepper – start with 1/2 tsp and add more to taste
  • Whipping cream – adds a creaminess to the soup and offsets acidity.
  • Parmesan cheese – adds saltiness to the soup and balances acidity. Adding parmesan adds enough salt and I usually don’t add more.

Preparation

  1. Saute Aromatics – heat a non-reactive pot over medium heat. Melt in 4 Tbsp butter then sautee onions until softened and golden (10-12 min). Add minced garlic and saute another minute.
  2. Make the tomato soup base – stir in two 28 oz cans of crushed tomatoes with their juice, your chicken stock, chopped basil, sugar and black pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat, partially cover and simmer 10 minutes.
  3. Blend if desired – use an immersion blender in the pot or blend in batches using a blender (be careful not to overfill the blender with hot liquid) and return soup to the pot.
  4. Add cream and parmesan – stir in the heavy cream and shredded parmesan. Return to a simmer and season to taste if needed.
  5. Serve – ladle into warm bowls and garnish with more parmesan and basil.

item.title: Iranian Stew Fesenjan
item.dc:creator: rezahakimazar
item.description:
Ingredients

  • Walnuts: To create the luscious sauce, I finely grind the walnuts.

  • Onion: Imbues the dish with a fresh aromatic flavor.

  • Chicken Thighs: When it comes to slow-cooking thighs are a top choice. Alternatively, you can use chicken drumsticks or quarters. Remove the skin but leave the bone in for further flavor.

  • Extra Virgin Olive Oil: The walnuts release a lot of oil so you only need a little extra virgin olive oil to fry the onions.

  • Turmeric, Cinnamon and Saffron: These spices flavor the stew with subtle earthy (turmeric), woody (cinnamon) and floral (saffron) tones. The overall feeling from this stew is warm. If you’re curious about saffron, one of the world’s most interesting spices, learn all about it in our What Is Saffron? Essential Guide.

  • Water: The cooking liquid and basis of the rich pomegranate molasses and walnut sauce.

  • Pomegranate Molasses: This gives the stew the sour flavor and helps to balance the richness of the walnuts in the sauce. It also gives the fesenjan its beautiful dark brown color. You can purchase it or make it yourself by using this homemade pomegranate molasses recipe.

  • Sugar balances and complements the tartness of the pomegranate molasses.

  • Salt and freshly ground black pepper elevates the other flavors and adds a subtle heat.

  • Pomegranate Seeds: Sprinkle these little jewel-toned bursts of flavor over the top of the stew as a garnish just before serving.

Procedure

  1. Grind the Walnuts
  2. Toast the Walnuts
  3. Cook Onions
  4. Cook Chicken Thighs
  5. Add the Ground Walnuts
  6. Add Pomegranate Molasses, Sugar and Saffron
  7. Add the Chicken, Simmer and Season

item.title: Cup of Sugar
item.dc:creator: paul-gallenkemper
item.description:
Ingredients

roll the dice on how much sugar you want.

dice <- c(1,2,3,4,5,6)
amount_of_sugar <- sample(dice, 1)

Procedure

You need to put 3 grams in a cup.

Photo of result

item.title: Peanut Udon
item.dc:creator: octomike
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 400 g Udon (fresh)
  • 2 tbsp salted peanuts
  • 2 tbsp sesame
  • 10 g fresh ginger
  • 1 garlic clove
  • 1 large tomato
  • 1 tbsp sesame oil
  • 1/2 tsp chili flakes
  • 2 spring onions
  • 1/2 bunch cilantro
  • 2 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1/2 lime
  • 2 tbsp peanut butter
  • 100 ml coconut milk

Procedure

  1. Roughly chop the peanuts, toast them in a pan with sesame seeds until golden brown, then transfer them to a bowl and set aside.
  2. Peel and finely chop the ginger and garlic. Heat sesame oil in the pan and sauté the ginger, chili flakes, and garlic over medium heat.
  3. Meanwhile, wash the tomato, dice it into small pieces, and add it to the pan.
  4. Wash, trim, and finely slice the spring onions. Wash, shake dry, and chop the cilantro. Set both aside.
  5. Place the noodles in a bowl, cover with hot water, and let them sit for 1-2 minutes.
  6. Add 2 tablespoons of peanut butter to the pan and mix well. Squeeze in the lime juice. Stir in the soy sauce and coconut milk until the sauce is creamy.
  7. Stir in 3/4 of the spring onions, drain the noodles, and add them to the peanut sauce in the pan. Mix everything well and briefly continue to fry.
  8. Divide the noodles between 2 plates and serve garnished with the remaining spring onions, cilantro, and the sesame-peanut mixture.

media:content.url: https://lennartwittkuhn.com/recipes/recipes/Add the URL to the image here

item.title: Peanutbutter Ramen
item.dc:creator: helenebreuer
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3 banana shallots, peeled and chopped to get 100g
  • 2 lemongrass stalks, bottom two-thirds sliced, the rest discarded
  • 10 garlic cloves (30g), peeled and roughly chopped
  • 8cm x 8cm piece fresh ginger (60g), peeled and roughly chopped
  • 2½ tbsp gochujang paste
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1¾ tsp salt, plus ½ tsp extra for the tempeh
  • 2 tsp Rapeseed oil
  • 3 tsp light brown soft sugar
  • 4 tbsp (65g) smooth peanut butter
  • 1 x 400ml tin coconut milk
  • 2 limes, zested and quartered
  • 250g ramen noodles
  • 200g tempeh, chopped into a mince with a knife
  • 250g pak choi, shredded lengthways
  • 40g fresh coriander, chopped

Procedure

1. Make curry paste:

Put all the curry paste ingredients and two tablespoons each of rapeseed oil and water in a small blender and blitz to a smooth paste.

2. Make the ramen broth:

Next, make the ramen broth. Put three tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a large saucepan on a medium heat and, once hot, add the spice paste and fry, stirring regularly, for 10 minutes. Stir in two teaspoons of the sugar and cook for a further two minutes. Transfer a tablespoon and a half of the mix to a bowl and put to one side. Stir the peanut butter into the pan, then add the coconut milk, lime zest and a litre of water. Bring up to a simmer, then cook on a low heat for 10 minutes.

3. Make the noodles & tempeh:

Meanwhile, make the noodles and tempeh. Cook the noodles according to the packet instructions, then drain in a colander, rinse under cold water and drain again. Add a little oil to the colander, toss to coat the noodles so they don’t stick, then set aside. To cook the tempeh, put two tablespoons of rapeseed oil in a nonstick frying pan on a medium heat and, when hot, add the tempeh mince and fry, stirring often, for five minutes, until crisp and browning. Add the reserved curry paste mix, the remaining teaspoon of sugar and the extra half-teaspoon of salt, fry, stirring, for another three or four minutes, then take off the heat.

4. Serve the ramen:

To serve, divide the ramen broth between four bowls, then divide the noodles between the bowls. Top with the shredded pak choy, crumbled tempeh and coriander, squeeze the juice of a quarter of a lime over each portion and serve with another lime wedge on the side of each bowl.

item.title: Fortune cookies
item.dc:creator: MarieBouwgena
item.description:
Ingredients

For the Fortune Cookies

  • Egg white from 3 eggs
  • 60g powder sugar
  • 45g margarine
  • 60g flour
  • a pinch of salt

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven on 180 degree
  2. Melt the margarine
  3. Beat the egg white with the salt until it is fluffy
  4. Mix the melted margarine with the powder sugar, the fluffy egg white and the flour
  5. Using a spoon, spread a tablespoon of the dough thinly into a circle on a baking tray lined with baking paper (or a suitable alternative).
  6. Bake it for 5-7 minutes
  7. Now everything has to happen very quickly (it’s best if everyone helps): carefully remove the still soft cookies from the paper with a knife and place a prepared note message on top.
  8. Fold the cookies into semicircles and quickly fold them again with the straight side over the edge of a bowl or glass to create the typical fortune cookie shape.

Enjoy your fortune!

item.title: Granola
item.dc:creator: nclz
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 500 g oats
  • 50 g walnuts
  • 50 g cashews
  • 50 g almonds
  • 50 g pecans
  • 25 g cacao nibs
  • 50 g chia seeds
  • 50 g dried apricots, cranberries (or whatever you like)
  • other seeds or nuts you like
  • 2-3 teaspoons honey (or a vegan alternative)
  • 2 teaspoons cinnamon

Procedure

  1. Preheat the oven.
  2. Chop the nuts, if desired.
  3. Mix all the ingredients (except the dried fruits, cacao nibs and chia seeds).
  4. Spread it on a baking sheet.
  5. Put it into the oven. Bake until the granola is golden brown.
  6. Let the granola cool. Add the dried fruits and chia seeds.
  7. Use it as a topping or enjoy it for breakfast.

item.title: Hähnchenbrustfilet
item.dc:creator: JuCaHeWi
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 4 chicken fillets
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped
  • Juice of one lemon
  • 1 tsp lemon zest, grated
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh herbs (parsley, basil) for garnish

Procedure

  1. Prepare the marinade: In a bowl, mix the olive oil, chopped garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, oregano, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Marinate the chicken fillets: Place the chicken fillets in a large freezer bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over them and rub the fillets well with it. Seal the bag or cover the dish and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. For a more intense flavor, marinate overnight.
  3. Preheat the grill: Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
  4. Grill the chicken: Remove the chicken fillets from the marinade and let the excess marinade drip off. Place the fillets on the hot grill and grill for about 6-8 minutes per side, until they are cooked through and have nice grill marks. The exact grilling time depends on the thickness of the fillets.
  5. Serve: Place the grilled chicken fillets on plates and garnish with fresh herbs. They go well with a fresh salad or grilled vegetables.

Enjoy your meal!

item.title: Vegan Carrot Cake
item.dc:creator: sivanujah
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 250g Carrots
  • 125g Vegan Butter at room temperature
  • 100g sugar/maple syrup
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 pinch vanilla extract
  • 2 flax eggs
  • 125g all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 1/2 tsp baking powder
  • 100g almonds
  • 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda

Procedure

  1. Preheat oven to 180°C top and bottom heat. Grease a round baking pan.
  2. For the batter, peel the carrots and finely grate them.
  3. Beat the soft butter with sugar, salt, and vanilla until creamy in a mixing bowl. Then stir in the grated carrots and flax eggs.
  4. Now sift in the flour, cinnamon, and baking powder. Also add the almonds, vinegar, and baking soda, and stir everything briefly until just combined.
  5. Fill the batter into the prepared baking pan, smooth it out, and bake on medium rack for 30-40 minutes.

item.title: Cinnamon Rolls
item.dc:creator: CJarolyn
item.description:
Ingredients

For the dough:

  • 500g all-purpose flour
  • 7g (1 packet) instant yeast
  • 250ml warm milk
  • 75g granulated sugar
  • 75g unsalted butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 large egg

For the filling:

  • 75g unsalted butter, softened
  • 100g brown sugar
  • 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon

For the glaze:

  • 100g powdered sugar
  • 2-3 tablespoons milk
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)

Preparation

Prepare the Dough:

  1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm milk and instant yeast.
  2. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
  3. Add the melted butter, sugar, salt, and egg to the yeast mixture.
  4. Stir until well combined.
  5. Gradually add the flour to the mixture, stirring until a dough forms.
  6. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, until the dough is smooth and elastic.
  7. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
  8. Prepare the Filling: In a small bowl, mix together the softened butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon until well combined.

Assemble the Rolls:

  1. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and roll it out on a floured surface into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick.
  2. Spread the cinnamon-sugar filling evenly over the dough.
  3. Starting from one long edge, tightly roll up the dough into a log.
  4. Use a sharp knife to cut the log into 12 equal-sized rolls.

Bake the Rolls:

  1. Place the rolls in a greased baking dish, leaving a little space between each roll.
  2. Cover the dish with a clean kitchen towel and let the rolls rise for another 30-45 minutes.
  3. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
  4. Once risen, bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.

Make the Glaze:

  1. In a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
  2. Adjust the consistency by adding more milk if needed.
  3. Serve: Once the rolls are baked, let them cool for a few minutes before drizzling the glaze over the top. Serve warm and enjoy your homemade Zimtschnecken!
